ai-patthana16.8:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma
ai-patthana16.8:0.3_0: Seeing what is good, pleasing is always,
ai-patthana16.8:1.1_0: It is the condition for the unprincipled repetition, not for the sake of the Dhamma, nor for the purpose of being incompetent condition.
ai-patthana16.8:1.1_1: Not knowing what is an indeterminate, not for someone who is skilled in goodness. ...
ai-patthana16.8:1.1_2: These six classes of questions should be understood. There are three must be analytic knowledges, when the six classes of rebirth. There is none of those who have not arrived at all.
ai-patthana16.8:2.1_0: A skillful teaching doesn’t give rise to a cause or condition.
